Identification.LongTitle: Competency of Operators of Pleasure Craft Regulations

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Transport and the Minister of Fisheries and Oceans, pursuant to section 562a of the Canada Shipping Act, hereby makes the annexed Competency of Operators of Pleasure Craft Regulations.

Section.Text: The definitions in this section apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: accredited course means a series of lessons in respect of boating safety that has been accredited by the Department of Transport under section 6. (cours agréé)
accredited test means a test referred to in paragraph 7(4)(c). (examen agréé)

Boating Safety Course Completion Card means a card issued, by a person who provided a boating safety course in Canada, to a person who successfully completed the course before April 1, 1999. (carte de réussite d’un cours de sécurité nautique)
candidate means a person presenting themselves at a test site to take the test or a person taking the test for a Pleasure Craft Operator Card. (candidat)
course provider means a person who has obtained the accreditation of a boating safety course in accordance with section 6. (prestataire de cours)
operate means the action of controlling the speed and course of a pleasure craft. (conduire)

Pleasure Craft Operator Card means a card issued by a course provider that attests that the cardholder has received a mark of at least 75 per cent on a test. (carte de conducteur d’embarcation de plaisance)

proof of age means a Pleasure Craft Operator Card, birth certificate, baptismal certificate, passport, driver’s licence or other official document that sets out the person’s date of birth. (preuve d’âge)

proof of competency means a Pleasure Craft Operator Card, a Boating Safety Course Completion Card, a rental boat safety checklist, proof of the successful completion of a boating safety course, or a certificate or other document pertaining to boating safety knowledge, as required under section 4. (preuve de compétence)
proof of residency means a passport, driver’s licence or other official government document that sets out a person’s place of residence. (preuve de résidence)
test means a boating safety test that meets the requirements of section 7 taken for the purpose of obtaining a Pleasure Craft Operator Card. (examen)

Subsection.Text: These Regulations apply in respect of pleasure craft that are fitted with a motor and that are operated for recreational purposes in Canadian waters, other than the waters of the Northwest Territories and Nunavut.
These Regulations do not apply in respect of seaplanes.
Subject to subsection (2), no person shall operate a pleasure craft unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is competent to operate the pleasure craft in accordance with section 4; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has proof of competency on board.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is operating the pleasure craft under the supervision of an instructor as part of an accredited course;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not a resident of Canada and whose pleasure craft is in Canada for less than 45 consecutive days; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has proof on board that the person holds a certificate of competency, training certificate, endorsement or other equivalency listed in the schedule.

Subsection.Text: No person in charge of a pleasure craft shall allow another person to operate the pleasure craft unless that other person is a person referred to in subsection (1) or (2).
A person referred to in paragraph (2)(b) or 4(2)(b) shall not operate a pleasure craft without proof of residency on board the pleasure craft.

Except where replacing a previously issued card or issuing a card to a person providing proof that the person holds a certificate of competency, training certificate, endorsement or other equivalency listed in the schedule, no course provider shall issue a Pleasure Craft Operator Card to a candidate unless the provider or their agent has administered to the candidate a test that meets the requirements of section 7.
Subject to subsection (2), a person is competent to operate a pleasure craft

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the person has received a mark of at least 75 per cent on a test and has been issued a Pleasure Craft Operator Card;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the person had successfully completed a recreational boating safety course in Canada before April 1, 1999 and has a Boating Safety Course Completion Card or other written proof of that completion; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a pleasure craft rented from a rental agency or from a representative of a rental agency,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the person meets the condition set out in paragraphs (a) or (b), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the person and the agency or representative complete and sign, before the pleasure craft is operated, a rental boat safety checklist that contains the information referred to in section 8 and the person operates the pleasure craft only during the rental period.

Subsection.Text: A person who is not a resident of Canada is competent to operate a pleasure craft if the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has proof of competency as set out in subsection (1); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has been issued a certificate or other similar document that meets the requirements of the person’s state or country.

Subsection.Text: A person shall apply for the accreditation of a boating safety course by making a written request and submitting 4 copies of the course to the Department of Transport.
The Department of Transport may accredit, as an accredited course, a course that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: defines boating terms and expressions;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: describes the responsibilities of the operators of pleasure craft, including the requirement to have the appropriate equipment and charts, maps and other documents on board the pleasure craft;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sets out safety procedures to be followed by operators and occupants of pleasure craft, including appropriate responses to boating emergencies and other situations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: sets out general boating safety knowledge; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: reviews these Regulations and the provisions of the following statutes and regulations relating to the matters referred to in paragraphs (a) to (c), as applicable:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Canada Shipping Act, 2001,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the provisions of the Contraventions Act and the regulations made under it that pertain to contraventions of the Canada Shipping Act, 2001 and the regulations made under it,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Criminal Code,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the Vessel Operation Restriction Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the Navigation Safety Regulations, 2020,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the Collision Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Small Vessel Regulations.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: suspend the accreditation of any boating safety course where the course no longer meets the criteria set out in subsection (2); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: reinstate the accreditation where the reasons for the suspension have been remedied.

Heading.TitleText: Test Administered Under an Approved Protocol

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 7.1, a course provider or their agent may administer a test only if the test

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is administered in accordance with the course provider’s test protocol submitted to and approved by the Minister; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the requirements of subsections (3) and (4).

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall approve a test protocol if it contains procedures ensuring that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the identity and age of each candidate are verified;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each candidate receives clear instructions, before the test begins, on

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the maximum duration of the test,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the passing grade, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the procedures to be followed to complete the test;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: during the test, no candidate

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: communicates with any person other than the person administering the test,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has access to documentation other than the test and the instructions that relate to it,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: copies, removes from the test site or sends to anyone the test or any portion of it, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: consumes alcoholic beverages;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the test site is a site

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that is designated solely for the use of the person administering the test, candidates and, if applicable, agents of the Department of Transport, for the duration of the test,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that is owned, leased, occupied or otherwise controlled by the course provider but that is in no way under the control of a candidate taking the test such as a site that is the residence of a candidate taking the test,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of which the course provider has undertaken to permit access, on request, to any agents of the Department of Transport,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: that conforms to the description furnished by the course provider in their test protocol, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: that, in the case of a test site situated within a space where a commercial or sporting activity occurs concurrently with the test, is delineated by walls or partitions in such a manner that the candidates are incapable of seeing anything outside the test site during the taking of the test except through a window;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: no candidate may take a test more than once in one day;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any candidate who does not comply with the requirements of paragraph (c) is removed from the test site and their answers automatically rejected for that test;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the ratio of candidates to persons administering the test shall not exceed 20 to 1; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the test protocol shall be available at the test site for consultation, including an inspection by an agent of the Department of Transport.

Subsection.Text: All tests shall be supervised throughout their duration by the person administering the test and can be provided to a candidate only at a test site and in one of the following formats:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in paper format;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: electronically by computer; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: by one of the following means if the candidate is the sole candidate present:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a candidate who does not fluently read English or French or is deaf or mute, by the person administering the test asking the questions orally, if necessary through a competent and independent interpreter, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other specific case, by any other method of communication that meets the needs generated by a candidate’s documented health problem.

Subsection.Text: The following requirements apply to the type of test specified:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: every test shall be composed of 36 items or questions distributed as follows:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 9 items or questions on the matters referred to in paragraph 6(2)(a) and the provisions referred to in paragraph 6(2)(e) that are applicable to those matters,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 9 items or questions on the matters referred to in paragraph 6(2)(b) and the provisions referred to in paragraph 6(2)(e) that are applicable to those matters,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 12 items or questions on the matters referred to in paragraph 6(2)(c) and the provisions referred to in paragraph 6(2)(e) that are applicable to those matters, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: 6 items or questions on the matters referred to in paragraph 6(2)(d);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a test other than one referred to in paragraph (c) and in the case of all tests administered by computer, the items or questions shall be randomly selected from the most recent bank of questions provided by the Department of Transport to course providers who have had their test protocols approved under subsection (2); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a test accredited before July 24, 2003 and administered by the person who obtained the accreditation or their agent, the test shall not have been altered since that accreditation.

Subsection.Text: If a course provider issues a Pleasure Craft Operator Card without having complied with subsection 3(4), if a test is not administered in accordance with the test protocol approved under subsection 7(2) and applicable to it or it is demonstrated that a course is being given or a test is being administered to a candidate in such a manner that, on completion of the course or the test, the person’s knowledge of the matters referred to in subsection 6(2) is doubtful, the Department of Transport may do any or all of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: suspend the accreditation of an accredited course;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: suspend the accreditation of an accredited test; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: suspend the approval of a test protocol under subsection 7(2).

Subsection.Text: The Department of Transport shall reinstate an accreditation or approval suspended under subsection (1) if the situation that justified the suspension has been remedied.

No person shall administer a course whose accreditation has been suspended or a test whose accreditation or whose test protocol approval has been suspended, except where an accreditation or approval has been reinstated.

Section.Text: A rental agency or a representative of a rental agency shall include, in the rental boat safety checklist for a pleasure craft, a statement that the agency or representative has given to every person who will operate the pleasure craft information pertaining to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the operation of the pleasure craft;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the principal boating safety rules; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the geographic features and hazards in the area in which the pleasure craft will be operated.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on April 1, 1999.
